name: Alexander Enos
heroSubtitle: engineering student â€¢ programmer â€¢ outdoors fan

aboutMe.title: My Background
aboutMe.text: I'm a born-and-raised Oregonian who has a passion for creating and understanding things. I graduated from SEHS in 2023 and currently attend college at LCC. My main hobby is programming which I learned by myself and practice every day. I find it extremely fun to create projects, particularly in computer graphics. I also have interests in biology, health and food, voxels, hiking, mountain biking, white water kayaking, finance, beekeeping, and landrace/natural farming.

aboutMe.title: Recently
aboutMe.text: For the first time in my life I know what it's like to take care of a pet. During my childhood I was allergic to dogs and cats, so I never got the chance to take care of one, that was until last year, when the CDS (Cat Distribution System) changed that for me. Although the little rascal, Finn, requires a lot of attention, it's been an eye opening experience to be responsible for something living, and totally given me new perspective.

aboutMe.title: In the Future
aboutMe.text: I hope I get the opportunity to have a large garden, large enough to share the bounty with others and bond over locally grown food. I think it's really important to support local farmers that practice restorative agriculture and are working to restore soil conditions. I hope to be a part of that in the future.

achievements.title: Graduated High School
achievements.description: Was a part of IB IHS program for 3 years. I completed AP classes too.

achievements.title: Learning to Program
achievements.description: You can learn anything! Never let yourself think that you're not smart enough!

achievements.title: Attending College
achievements.description: I'm extremely grateful for this opportunity!

strengths.title: Algorithmic Thinking
strengths.description: Although I'm a sensitive and an emotional person, I can turn problems into a set of steps and repeatable instructions. I can identify patterns and inefficiencies and think about things abstractly.

strengths.title: Understanding others
strengths.description: I can generally get a feeling for what others are thinking which helps me communicate easier.

strengths.title: Kindness & Empathy
strengths.description: I try and live by the golden rule, and try not to judge people or treat them unfairly. I try and be understanding of everyone and the place they're in.

strengths.title: Problem Solving
strengths.description: I'm always thinking, always questioning. I can break complex problems down into smaller simpler problems. I like to think "Nothing is impossible" and there is "Always a way" to achieve something.

goals.title: Time management
goals.description: I would like to refine my routines and become more consistent this term. I would also like to spread out my work more effectively, so I never feel overwhelmed or get bored.

goals.title: Use Lane as a steping stone
goals.description: I hope I can use this opportunity given to me at Lane to build a foundation of knowledge and let others know that I'm capable.

goals.title: Create something meaningful
goals.description: I would like to work in a career where I feel like I'm creating something meaningful for myself and others. Currently, I think that will come from a degree in bio-engineering.

goals.title: Work more with others
goals.description: I would like to improve my collaboration skills because creating truly awesome things is only possible when people come together and communicate.

programming.title: Indie Developer Simulator
programming.description: A 3D browser-based experience where you roleplay as a game programmer. Built from scratch with JavaScript and WebGL.

volunteer.title: Arboretum Volunteer
volunteer.description: Worked with other volunteers to maintain the grounds.

volunteer.title: Gardening
volunteer.description: Helped plant vegetables and prepare soil for growing.
